moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3 Qa5: It is my joy when players pull back their queen or give check on the e-file. This is the only move.
moves.4. Nf3 e5 5. d4: I pull a reverse Scandinavian Defense.
moves.6. Ne5 Bf5 7. f3 exf3 8. Qxf3 Be6: A painful retreat. Maybe g6 would have been better?
moves.9. Qxb7: I snatch up the free pawn.
moves.9... Qb6 10. Bb5+: I was scared of my queen becoming trapped.
moves.12... Nd8 13. Qf3: I should have protected the d-pawn instead.
moves.15. O-O: I give up my knight to try and fight back.
moves.15... Qxc3 16. Rab1: ? I had dreams of glory after Rb8.
moves.16... Bd5 17. Qf4: I continue to flounder. Qe2 was mandatory.
moves.18... Qc8: Why didn't he take the pawn?
moves.19. Rfe1: Setting up a painful discovered attack...
moves.19... O-O 20. Qg3: ?? I was thinking about Bh6! and black is in trouble.
moves.21. Qh4: ? Not sure what I was doing.
moves.24. Rb5: Played for a lack of better options.
moves.26... Nb6 27. Bxb6 axb6 28. Rxb6: Score is even and I have a passed pawn. I am winning right? Turns out I had one more screw-up to get out of my system.
moves.28... Ne6 29. Rd7 g6 30. Ra6: ?? I planned to double on the seventh and eat up his king-side pawns.
moves.32... Nc5: In the following moves we shuffle our pieces around...
moves.35... Nxe5 36. a4 f6 37. a5 Ra8 38. Ra4: I was ready to resign at this point.
moves.40. Kf2 g5: I bring my king into action.
moves.43... Nb5+: ? wastes a move. h5! was needed.
moves.44. Kc5 Nc7 45. a7: It looks like a draw to me.
moves.45... h5 46. Kc6 Ne6 47. Kb7 Rg8 48. a8=: I smile thinking I can draw.
moves.49... Nd7+ 50. Kc7 Nf6: ??? THis move deserves another question mark. My queen escapes!
moves.51... Rg7+ 52. Kd6 Rb7: ? It didn't matter much he was lost.
